data.title: The Matt Pierce Blog Podcast - Spreaker
data.snippet:
23 MAR 2025 ¬∑ Understanding who is watching your content is the first step to growing a meaningful and engaged YouTube community. In this video, we dive into how to interpret YouTube analytics to better understand your audience demographics ‚Äî from age and gender to location and viewer habits. I‚Äôll walk you through key insights, what they mean, and how you can use them to make smarter content decisions. Whether you're just starting out or looking to refine your strategy, this episode will help you connect more deeply with the people who matter most ‚Äî your viewers.  What you‚Äôll learn: - Where to find YouTube audience analytics - How to interpret demographic data effectively - Why knowing your audience can shape your content and channel growth If you‚Äôve found value in my content and want [...] show less

The Matt Pierce Blog Podcast is your gateway to deeper conversations beyond my YouTube channel. Here, I dive into thought-provoking topics about Texas, the American West, and the raw realities of life‚Äîall through the lens of authentic storytelling, historical context, and unfiltered analysis. This podcast is where logic, credibility, and emotional connection come together to challenge conventional narratives and spark meaningful discussions. Whether I‚Äôm exploring Texas history, American identity, resilience, or modern society, this is where ideas go beyond the surface. If you appreciate real talk, informed perspectives, and no-nonsense discourse, join me as I navigate the bigger picture‚Äîone episode at a time.

data.title: Who's Listening? A Demographic Breakdown of the 2025 Podcast ...
data.snippet:
Income Level: The Affluent and Engaged Listener

Podcast audiences tend to be more affluent than average social media users, making them highly valuable for advertisers and B2B brands.

|  |  |  |
 --- 
| Income Level | Share of Listeners | Notable Traits |
| $100K+ annually | 31% | Highly educated, leadership-oriented, and brand-loyal. |
| $50K‚Äì$99K | 44% | Core audience segment. Mix of professionals, entrepreneurs, and freelancers. |
| Under $50K | 25% | Often students, early-career professionals, or international audiences. |

According to our Podcast Statistics 2025 report, these higher-income listeners are 73% more likely to take action after hearing a podcast ad than users who encounter traditional display or video ads.

Education: A Highly Informed Audience [...] This article breaks down the 2025 podcast audience demographics by age, gender, income, education, and region, using the latest global data and insights from our Podcast Statistics 2025 and Why It Matters for Professionals, Business Owners & Advocates report.

## The Big Picture: The 2025 Podcast Landscape

Let‚Äôs start with a snapshot of the industry:

Podcasting‚Äôs expansion in 2025 isn‚Äôt just about reach, it‚Äôs about relevance. 

Listeners aren‚Äôt just tuning in; they‚Äôre engaging, subscribing, and buying from brands they trust.

## Age: Millennials Lead, Gen Z Rising

Age continues to be one of the strongest predictors of podcast listenership, and the trends in 2025 are clear. [...] |  |  |  |
 --- 
| Age Group | Share of Total Listeners | Behavior Insights |
| 18‚Äì24 (Gen Z) | 22% | Discover podcasts via YouTube, TikTok, and social platforms. Prefer shorter, video-integrated episodes. |
| 25‚Äì34 (Young Millennials) | 30% | The most active podcast consumers. Use podcasts for learning, entrepreneurship, and lifestyle improvement. |
| 35‚Äì44 (Older Millennials / Gen X) | 21% | Listen during commutes and workouts. Value educational and business podcasts. |
| 45‚Äì54 (Gen X) | 14% | Growing audience segment, especially in business, finance, and wellness genres. |
| 55+ (Boomers) | 13% | Prefer traditional-style shows, interviews, and news podcasts. Increasing adoption due to accessibility and smart devices. |

data.title: 24 Podcast Stats and Facts You Should Know in 2024
data.snippet:
‚Äç

## Podcast listenership and demographics

### 1. Podcast listeners are loyal with 71% of total weekly consumers tuning into episodes within 24 hours of release

This stat highlights the immediacy with which listeners engage with new content. This means that podcast advertising campaigns can have an immediate impact. Plus, advertisers can place timely ads that are relevant to current events, trends, or promotions, knowing they will reach listeners quickly.

For creators, this stat signifies that podcast listeners are a loyal audience who are more likely to support your show through subscriptions, merchandise, or donations.

### 2. Most listeners tune into over 3 podcasts a week, favoring shows published on an ongoing basis [...] These stats speak to:

 Who podcast listeners are
 The state of audio advertising and podcast marketing
 The video podcasting dilemma
 The branded podcast landscape

Without further ado, let‚Äôs jump into the latest podcast stats and what they mean for you.

### 1. Podcast listeners are loyal with 71% of total weekly consumers tuning into episodes within 24 hours of release

This stat highlights the immediacy with which listeners engage with new content. This means that podcast advertising campaigns can have an immediate impact. Plus, advertisers can place timely ads that are relevant to current events, trends, or promotions, knowing they will reach listeners quickly. [...] Despite layoffs and cuts, podcasting continues to reach more people than ever. This is important for both brands evaluating their current podcast spend and creators determining the direction of their series.

H3. 4. Podcast listeners are more affluent and educated than the general population

If you‚Äôre looking to reach audiences with household income over $75,000, who own a home, and have been to college ‚Äì podcasting may be the avenue for you.

For advertisers, this helps target your ads more effectively. For podcasters or brands creating their own shows, these demographic insights will help you better frame your tone and content.

H3. 5. Since 2014, the average time spent listening to podcasts has increased by 450%

data.title: Podcast Listener Demographics: Reach the Right Audience
data.snippet:
## Understanding Key Podcast Audience Demographics

Creating an effective podcast advertising strategy is all about understanding your audience. SiriusXM Podcast Network audiences cross all ages, genders, and interests‚Äîfrom sports content, to entertainment, to true crime. And with 70M listeners on our network, there's a huge opportunity for brands to tap in. Advertisers looking to resonate with these audiences can craft targeted marketing strategies that resonate with specific groups and their interests.

## Age and Gender Influence on Podcast Listening Habits [...] ### SiriusXM Podcast Network Connects Brands and Listeners

We‚Äôre your one-stop-shop for reaching any demographic. We‚Äôve got more shows in the top 50 than any other podcast network, we‚Äôre #1 with women, and we‚Äôre #1 with listeners 55+, reaching 20% more than the next podcast network. And did we mention we‚Äôre a leader among listeners 13 and up? We can connect your brand with the right audiences no matter the genre or the generation.

## Redefine Your Podcast Advertising Strategy with SiriusXM Media

Understanding podcast demographics is key to refining your advertising strategy. We offer robust audience targeting, allowing you to pinpoint listeners, no matter who they are or how they‚Äôre listening.

When you‚Äôre ready to reach the right podcast listeners in the right way, hit our line. [...] A global, cultural force, Black audiences are on the pulse of today's trends. They‚Äôre discovering new content, technology, and products before anyone else, making them the ideal audience to target on podcasts. Black podcast listeners are looking for cultural connection, and 60% say authentic representation of their cultures perspectives and experiences in podcasts connects them to that. And when it comes to hearing your ads, 62% of black consumers say brands should support social issues/movements that benefit diverse communities to stay culturally relevant. With their interests diversifying across a variety of topics, 67% of Black podcast audiences listen to and watch multiple or different podcasts on any given day or week. Looking to be a part of the hottest cultural trends? This is your
